sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is MEDIUM for Friday and Saturday.

Significant surface water flooding impacts are probable in south Wales (Area A of Area of Concern Map 1) on Friday and Saturday. This is due to prolonged, heavy rainfall and strong winds, which may lead to wind blown debris blocking drains. Significant surface water flooding impacts are possible elsewhere in Wales and western parts of England - see areas B, C, D and E. 

Meanwhile, today (Thursday), localised heavy rain or showers over parts England and Wales may lead to some very localised surface water flooding but impacts are expected to be minimal.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is MEDIUM for Friday and Saturday. 

Significant river flooding impacts are probable in south Wales (Area A of Area of Concern Map 1) on Friday and Saturday due to prolonged, heavy rainfall. Significant river flooding impacts are possible elsewhere in Wales and western parts of England - see Areas B and C. 

Minor river flooding impacts are probable on Friday and Saturday in Area D, and possible in Area E of Areas of Concern Map 1.

sources.coastal:
The overall coastal/tidal flood risk is LOW for Friday.

On Friday a combination of large waves, strong winds and a large surge means that localised minor flooding impacts from wave over-topping, wind blown spray and high tide levels are probable around the coast of south Wales (Coastline F on Areas of Concern Map 2).

Also on Friday, along the coasts of west Wales, south-west England, and the Wye estuary localised minor impacts are possible (Coastlines G and H on Areas of Concern Map 2), and are possible but not expected for the Lancashire coastline. Minor coastal impacts are also possible on Saturday for the west Dorset coast (coastline I on Area of Concern Map 2).

Minor coastal flooding impacts are possible, but not expected, along parts of the south Wales coast today (Thursday) as a result of high astronomical tides.

sources.ground: The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

statement.headline: Significant river and surface water flooding impacts are probable in south Wales on Friday and Saturday (MEDIUM flood risk), and are possible for other parts of Wales and western England (LOW flood risk).

public_forecast.english_forecast:
Widespread flooding from surface water and rivers is probable across south Wales on Friday and Saturday, and is possible elsewhere in Wales and parts of western England. Properties could flood and there could be travel disruption.

Localised coastal/tidal flooding is probable on Friday along the south Wales coast and is also possible for west Wales, the Wye estuary, and some south-west coasts of England. The west coast of Dorset may continue to be affected on Saturday morning. Land, roads and some properties could flood and there could be local travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Mae'n debygol y ceir llifogydd eang o ddŵr wyneb ac afonydd ledled De Cymru ddydd Gwener a dydd Sadwrn, ac mae'n bosibl mewn mannau eraill yng Nghymru a rhannau o orllewin Lloegr. Gallai eiddo orlifo a gallai fod tarfu ar deithio.
 
Mae llifogydd arfordirol/llanw lleol yn debygol ar ddydd Gwener ar hyd arfordir De Cymru ac mae hefyd yn bosibl i orllewin Cymru, Aber Afon Gwy a rhai o arfordiroedd de-orllewinol Lloegr. Efallai y bydd arfordir gorllewinol Dorset yn parhau i gael ei effeithio fore Sadwrn. Gallai tir, ffyrdd a rhai eiddo orlifo a gellid cael teithio lleol
